intro: Cardanthera triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant produces three to five flowers per inflorescence, which are borne on slender, branching stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Cardanthera triflora is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
